greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number A(n,k) of set partitions of [n] such that for each block b the smallest integer interval containing b has at most k elements; square array A(n,k), n>=0, k>=0, read by antidiagonals.
comment: The sequence of column k satisfies a linear recurrence with constant coefficients of order 2^(k-1) for k>0.
link: Alois P. Heinz, Antidiagonals n = 0..40, flattened
Pierpaolo Natalini, Paolo Emilio Ricci, New Bell-Sheffer Polynomial Sets, Axioms 2018, 7(4), 71.
maple: b:= proc(n, m, l) option remember; `if`(n=0, 1,
mathematica: b[n_, m_, l_List] := b[n, m, l] = If[n == 0, 1, Sum[b[n - 1, Max[m, j], Append[ReplacePart[l, 1 -> Nothing], If[j <= m, 0, j]]], {j, Append[l, m + 1] ~Complement~ {0}}]]; A[n_, k_] := If[n == 0, 1, If[k < 2, k, b[n, 0, Array[0&, k-1]]]]; Table[A[n, d-n], {d, 0, 14}, {n, 0, d}] // Flatten (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Jan 06 2017, after _Alois P. Heinz_ *)
results.author: _Alois P. Heinz_, Sep 16 2016
